com.cdp.integrityperformancetool

Class StatisticsCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cdp.integrityperformancetool.StatisticsCollection

  • public class StatisticsCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    The StatisticsCollection class abstracts a logical grouping of IntegrityStatisticBean objects. The grouping of IntegrityStatisticBean objects are stored in the StatisticsCollection's "collection" attribute as an ArrayList of IntegrityStatisticBeans. The StatisticsColleciton is capable of computing group totals for most of the IntegrityStatisticBean attributes. For example, the StatisticsColleciton can compute and store the collection's Average value, which is computed as the average of all IntegrityStatisticBean average values existing in the colleciton. The StatisticCollection has many group computation and sort methods, as well as methods to add, remove, and get IntegrityStatisticBean objects from the collection attribute. Standard get and set methods exist to access the instance attributes.

    • Method Detail

      • addToCollection

        public void addToCollection(IntegrityStatisticBean arg_isb)
        Adds a single IntegrityStatisticBean object to the collection. This action causes for all "recompute" flags to be raised, so that all previously computed StatisticsCollection values will be recomputed before being returned or used.
        Parameters:
        arg_isb - (IntegrityStatisticBean) - The IntegrityStatisticBean to add to the existing collection.

      • addToCollection

        public void addToCollection(java.util.ArrayList<IntegrityStatisticBean> arg_isb_arrayList)
        Adds an ArrayList of IntegrityStatisticBean objects to the collection. This action causes for all "recompute" flags to be raised, so that all previously computed StatisticsCollection values will be recomputed before being returned or used.
        Parameters:
        arg_isb_arrayList - (IntegrityStatisticBean) - The IntegrityStatisticBean to add to the existing collection.

      • areComputationFieldsAccurate

        public boolean areComputationFieldsAccurate()
        Return boolean true if no computational fields need to be updated before they should be returned.
        Returns:
        (boolean) - true if none of the StatisticsCollection's group computation values need to be recomputed. false if any of the group computation values need to be recomputed.

      • clearCollection

        public void clearCollection()
        Clears the current collection attribute of all IntegrityStatisticBean objects. This effectively removes all IntegrityStatisticBean objects from the StatisticsCollection and raises all group value recomputation flags.

      • collapseStatistic

        public void collapseStatistic(java.lang.String arg_statName,
                              java.lang.String arg_statGroup)
        Combines all duplicate named IntegrityStatisticBean objects in the collection into a single IntegrityStatisticBean object in the collection, and removes the duplicates. Each individual IntegrityStatisticBean's values are combined and recomputed appropriately into the final collapsed Statistic.
        Parameters:
        arg_statName - (String) - The name attribute value of the IntegrityStatisticBean to combine all duplicates of.
        arg_statGroup - (String) - The group attribute value of the IntegrityStatisticBean to combine all duplicates of. This is used to ensure that only exact duplicates are combined, and not any statistics that have the same name, but different groupings.

      • collapseAllStatistics

        public void collapseAllStatistics()
        Executes the collapseStatistic method against all IntegrityStatisticBean objects existing in the collection.

      • collapseStatisticsByDate

        public void collapseStatisticsByDate()
        Groups IntegrityStatisticBeans by start and end date. Those that have the same start and end date are combined into a single IntegrityStatisticBean.

      • computeAllCollectionStatistics

        public void computeAllCollectionStatistics()
        Executes all StatisticsCollection group computation methods.

      • computeCollectionAverageValue

        public void computeCollectionAverageValue()
        Computes the StatisticsCollection collectionAverageValue attribute value by averaging the average value of all IntegrityStatisticBean objects in the collection.

        public void computeCollectionCountValue()
        Computes the StatisticsCollection collectionCountValue attribute value by computing the total of all IntegrityStatisticBean objects count values in the collection.

      • computeCollectionMaximumObject

        public void computeCollectionMaximumObject()
        Determines the IntegrityStatistic object(s) in the collection which have the greatest max value. The object(s) are saved as an ArrayList in the collectionMaximumIsbObjectArrayList attribute, which will contain more than one IntegrityStatisticBean object if more than one have the same max value that is also the absolute max value of the collection.

      • computeCollectionMaximumValue

        public void computeCollectionMaximumValue()
        Computes the greatest max value for all IntegrityStatisticBean objects in the collection and saves this value as the collectionMaximumValue attribute.

      • computeCollectionMinimumObject

        public void computeCollectionMinimumObject()
        Determines the IntegrityStatistic object(s) in the collection which have the lowest min value. The object(s) are saved as an ArrayList in the collectionMinimumIsbObjectArrayList attribute, which will contain more than one IntegrityStatisticBean object if more than one have the same min value that is also the absolute min value of the collection.

      • computeCollectionMinimumValue

        public void computeCollectionMinimumValue()
        Computes the lowest min value for all IntegrityStatisticBean objects in the collection and saves this value as the collectionMinimumValue attribute.

        public void orderByIsbAverageValue()

      • removeFromCollection

        public void removeFromCollection(IntegrityStatisticBean arg_isb)
        Removes a single IntegrityStatisticBean object from the collection. Raises recompute flags to recompute all StatisticsCollection attribute values.
        Parameters:
        arg_isb - (IntegrityStatisticBean) - the object to remove.

      • removeFromCollection

        public void removeFromCollection(int[] indicesToRemove)
        Removes one or more IntegrityStatisticBean objects from the collection.
        Parameters:
        indicesToRemove - (int[]) - array of integers representing the collection indices to remove.

      • removeFromCollection

        public void removeFromCollection(int index)
        Removes the IntegrityStatisticBean in the collection index provided.
        Parameters:
        index - (int) - integer index to remove from the collection.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String arg_name)
        Sets the StatisticsCollection name.
        Parameters:
        arg_name - (String) - name of the collection.

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String arg_filePath,
                        boolean arg_forceOverwrite)
        Creates a .csv file of all collection contents. Each IntegrityStatisticBean's data is printed to a single line with the columns: Start Date, End Date, Group, Statistic, Kind, Unit, Count, Total, Sum, Used, Min, Max, Average, Mode
        Parameters:
        arg_filePath - (String) - the complete system file path to create the .csv file.
        arg_forceOverwrite - (boolean) - if true and the file already exists, the existing file content will be overwritten.

      • writeCollectionTotalsToFile

        public void writeCollectionTotalsToFile(java.lang.String arg_filePath)
        Writes a single .csv entry using the StatisticsCollection total values as follows Column Name (value provided): Start Date (Earliest Collection Start Date), End Date (Latest Collection End Date), Group (group value of 1st collection item), Statistic (name value of 1st collection item), Kind (kind value of 1st collection item, Unit (unit value of 1st collection item), Count (collection count), Total (collection total count), Sum (collection sum), Used (used value of 1st collection item), Min (collection min), Max (collection max), Average (collection average), Mode (mode value of 1st collection item). This method will either create a new file or append to the bottom of an existing file.
        Parameters:
        arg_filePath - (String) - full system file path of the .csv file to create or append to.

      • writeToString

        public void writeToString()
        Utility method for troubleshooting or debugging. Prints the contents of the collection to the system console, with one collection object per line. IntegrityStatisticBean data is printed in the format: Start Date, End Date, Group, Statistic, Kind, Unit, Count, total, Sum, Used, Min, Max, Average, Mode
